s2r_classification.sink_type: Map credit burn (HONEY burned when clients consume map data via Map Credits)
s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: Burn-and-mint: clients purchase Map Credits with HONEY (burned); contributors earn HONEY for dashcam imagery
s2r_classification.notes: MIP-7 introduced map credit pricing; burn data queryable on Solana

s2r_classification.sink_type: Data marketplace burn (DIMO tokens burned for marketplace access)
s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: License burn: developers burn DIMO to access vehicle data via DIMO Developer License; stake required for data consumers
s2r_classification.notes: Marketplace launched 2024; burn volumes likely small

s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: Transaction fees partially burned on IoTeX L1; staking locks reduce circulating supply
s2r_classification.notes: IoTeX L1 has native burn; not queryable via standard Dune tables

s2r_classification.sink_type: Data subscription burn (WXM burned for weather data access)
s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: Data consumers burn WXM to access weather API/data marketplace; station operators earn WXM for verified weather data
s2r_classification.notes: Data marketplace active; burn volumes growing but small relative to emissions

s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: GRASS tokens staked for network access; no confirmed burn-and-mint; primarily emission-based rewards for bandwidth sharing
s2r_classification.notes: Revenue model is data sales (AI companies buy scraped data); token capture mechanism is indirect via staking

s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: Relay operators stake ANYONE tokens; bandwidth consumers may pay in ANYONE; no confirmed burn mechanism
s2r_classification.notes: Privacy/VPN relay; token economics still evolving

s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: Bandwidth contributors earn UPT; enterprise clients purchase proxy access; token burn/buyback details not public
s2r_classification.notes: Early-stage protocol; tokenomics may not be fully deployed

s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: WiFi users pay for connectivity; operators earn WRU; burn mechanism unclear from public docs
s2r_classification.notes: Community WiFi focused on Latin America; limited tokenomics disclosure

s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: No public token; centralized service model with blockchain backend for payments
s2r_classification.notes: India-focused community WiFi; may use Polygon for micropayments but no governance token

s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: Users earn CUDIS for health data from smart ring; data consumers may burn/stake CUDIS for access; mechanism details limited
s2r_classification.notes: Early-stage wearable DePIN; tokenomics likely not mature

s2r_classification.burn_mechanism: Autonomous delivery network; token economics not well documented
s2r_classification.notes: Very early stage; limited public information on burn mechanism

unit_economics.service_equivalence_note: LoRaWAN packets; coverage varies by geography
Helium Mobile relies on T-Mobile offload; not pure DePIN
Comparable quality for standard transcoding profiles
Retrieval speed and reliability differ; Filecoin optimized for archival
Coverage density differs significantly; Google has global baseline

unit_economics.source_depin: UpRock pricing page (uprock.com), free tier + paid plans
unit_economics.service_equivalence_note: UpRock uses idle bandwidth from real devices; quality/reliability may differ from enterprise proxy providers; IP pool size difference

unit_economics.source_depin: Grass docs (getgrass.io); no posted per-unit price; value accrues via GRASS token to bandwidth contributors
unit_economics.source_web2: Scale AI enterprise pricing; Appen public rate cards
unit_economics.service_equivalence_note: Not directly comparable: Grass provides raw web data via idle bandwidth, not labeled training data; different point in data pipeline

unit_economics.source_depin: DIMO app + docs (dimo.zone); users earn DIMO for sharing; data marketplace launched 2024
unit_economics.source_web2: Otonomo enterprise pricing (otonomo.io); Wejo partner pricing 2023
unit_economics.service_equivalence_note: DIMO collects OBD-II/CAN data from user vehicles; Otonomo aggregates OEM data feeds; coverage and granularity differ

unit_economics.source_depin: WeatherXM data marketplace (weatherxm.com); station operators earn WXM; API pricing tiered
unit_economics.source_web2: Tomorrow.io API pricing (developer plan); DTN enterprise (not publicly posted)
unit_economics.service_equivalence_note: WeatherXM has 6,000+ stations with hyperlocal data; Tomorrow.io uses satellite + model ensemble; quality depends on station density in area

unit_economics.depin_price: Free relay (earn ANYONE for running relay)
unit_economics.source_depin: Anyone Protocol (anyone.io); formerly Nym-adjacent; relay operators earn tokens; end-user pricing TBD
unit_economics.source_web2: NordVPN ($3.49/mo annual plan); ExpressVPN ($8.32/mo annual plan)
unit_economics.service_equivalence_note: Anyone uses onion-routing relay network; different privacy model from centralized VPN; speed/latency may differ; censorship resistance vs convenience tradeoff

unit_economics.source_depin: Wayru (wayru.io) community WiFi pricing for Latin America; WiFiDabba (wifidabba.com) India pricing
unit_economics.source_web2: Average ISP pricing in Latin America (GSMA data); India ISP pricing (Jio/Airtel)
unit_economics.service_equivalence_note: Community WiFi has limited range and speed vs fiber/DSL; serves underserved communities where ISP coverage is absent; apples-to-oranges for urban markets

unit_economics.source_depin: CUDIS (cudis.xyz) smart ring pricing; users earn CUDIS tokens for health data sharing
unit_economics.source_web2: Oura Ring Gen3 ($299) + subscription ($5.99/mo); Whoop ($239/yr subscription model)
unit_economics.service_equivalence_note: CUDIS ring has fewer sensors/features than Oura; value proposition is token earning + data ownership; health accuracy not independently validated

unit_economics.source_depin: IoTeX gas fees (iotex.io); purpose-built IoT blockchain; W3bstream middleware
unit_economics.service_equivalence_note: Not directly comparable: IoTeX is a blockchain for IoT devices; AWS IoT Core is cloud middleware; different abstraction layers

UPT.name: UpRock
UPT.description: UpRock serves as the open data layer for AI, transforming the future by democratizing the access to open data that fuels AI innovations. Unlike traditional models where specific tools or platforms dictate data accessibility, UpRock empowers users by enabling them to convert their idle internet bandw

DIMO.name: DIMO
DIMO.description: DIMO is an open vehicle connectivity platform. You can connect your car to DIMO, store your own data, share that data for discounts or new services, and earn $DIMO tokens. Developers can build applications on DIMO that work on any car.

HONEY.name: Hivemapper
HONEY.description:
HONEY is the cryptocurrency of the Hivemapper Network.
Built on top of Solana, HONEY rewards contributions to the mapping network. Building a map of the world is hard work, and HONEY rewards you for helping to create this valuable resource.

IOTX.name: IoTeX
IOTX.description: IoTeX is the blockchain platform for Real-World AI. Since 2017, its foundational infrastructure has delivered verified, real-time data from the real world to AI systems and decentralized applications. Powering  100+ projects and 40M devices across mobility, robotics, energy, health, and more, IoTeX
